name: Discover
purpose: Spark curiosity and teach mezcal diversity through visual intrigue. The viewer should feel like they’ve uncovered something: a species, a texture, a place, a detail. It’s education disguised as beauty.
what_this_pillar_is: Micro-learning through imagery (no lectures, no heavy text).
Agave diversity as the hero: species, textures, environments, silhouettes.
A sense of discovery: found objects, wild landscapes, subtle clues.
what_this_pillar_is_not: How-to guidance or buying/ordering optimisation (that is Level Up).
Glossy staged product ads or sterile e-commerce packshots.

content_goals.brand_goal: Position the cards as the coolest way to explore mezcal beyond Espadín, visually and intuitively.
content_goals.audience_goal: Make mezcal-curious people feel smart and pulled in without being intimidated.
content_goals.content_goal: Create scroll-stopping images that feel like a hidden door into agave worlds.

visual_story_rules.core_rule: Every Discover image must contain a ‘hook’ detail that makes you look twice.
hook_types_ranked: shadow silhouette revealing an agave form
cards interacting with wind / dust / terrain
agave textures cropped like abstract art
subtle sense of place (Oaxaca field edge, rocky hillside)
a micro ‘clue’ prop (salt dish, citrus peel, fibre strand)
composition_bias: product as a discovery artefact, not a billboard

motion_allowed: subtle hand entering frame as context

from_marketing_plan.title: Agave Shadows
from_marketing_plan.one_liner: A single card and a sharp agave shadow that rotates through different species.
visual_hooks: hard light creates crisp agave shape
scene_rules: Minimalist set with strong shadow geometry
Card stays crisp and true scale
Shadow must clearly read as agave (spiky rosette, spears)
motion_ideas: light source moves slightly so shadow shifts position

from_marketing_plan.title: Deck in the Wild
from_marketing_plan.one_liner: Cards feel found outdoors: dust, wind, terrain, real environment.
visual_hooks: cards crawling or flipping at the edge
scene_rules: Outdoor texture dominates (rock, soil, plant matter)
Cards are slightly imperfectly placed, not staged
Keep it believable: no floating cards

from_marketing_plan.title: Agave Origami
from_marketing_plan.one_liner: Agave as an object of obsession: sculptural, folded, studied, collected.
visual_hooks: handwritten notes implied but not readable
scene_rules: Craftsmanship feel: timber table, clay wall, warm light
No readable writing (blur or blank notes only)
Hands can appear but not faces
motion_ideas: cards spread like a solitary win

from_marketing_plan.title: Agave Facts
from_marketing_plan.one_liner: Extreme close crops of agave textures paired with a single card as the key.
scene_rules: Card is small and secondary but readable
No text overlays in-image (facts come from caption later)

discover_prompt_patterns: single card + strong agave shadow geometry
cards on raw terrain with wind movement
macro agave texture with small card clue
quiet study table with agave object and scattered cards

allowed_primary_subjects: deck box (rare, only if it feels discovered, not advertised)
scale_locks: Playing cards must be true-to-size 2.5 inches by 3.5 inches.
Cards must fit fully inside one adult hand if held.
No oversized cards, no warped edges.

people_and_framing.primary_rule: Discover should feel observational, not social. Humans are rare and peripheral.
allowed_people_modes: jimador hands (context only, no hero humans)

face_rule.rule: No full faces in Discover imagery. If any person appears, crop or blur beyond recognition.

camera_angles_ranked.label: Macro close-crop
camera_angles_ranked.notes: Perfect for Agave Facts and texture discovery.

camera_angles_ranked.label: Top-down (minimalist geometry)
camera_angles_ranked.notes: Strong for Agave Shadows, keeps it clean and graphic.

camera_angles_ranked.label: 45-degree close angle
camera_angles_ranked.notes: Best for deck in the wild, terrain depth.

lighting_ranked.label: Warm lamp glow
lighting_ranked.notes: Best for study-table or cantina clay wall setups.

lighting_ranked.label: Hard directional light for shadows
lighting_ranked.notes: Use ONLY for Agave Shadows concept.

scene_moment_templates: A single card sits in a sharp agave shadow
Wind lifts dust across cards on rocky ground
A card half-buried in soil beside agave fibres
Agave leaf serrations fill the frame, card as a clue
Light shifts and the agave silhouette rotates slowly
Cards lie on stone, one corner lifting in the breeze
A quiet study table with agave form and scattered cards
Close crop of rosette core texture with a single card nearby
hook_details: one card corner lifted by wind

caption_guidance: Keep the image clean. The caption can add the fact.
If you want a ‘fact’ angle, do it with text in the caption, not in the image.

hard_constraints_locked: no text overlays, no captions, no watermarks, no logos, no UI icons, no corner marks, no sparkles
no pristine studio staging, no glossy product-ad perfection, no sterile white backgrounds
no warped hands, no extra fingers
mezcal bottles must have blank or unbranded labels only
poured mezcal must be still liquid, never bubbly or fizzy
no readable text anywhere in the scene except on the reference card itself; all other writing must be blurred or illegible
playing cards must be true-to-size 2.5 inches by 3.5 inches, fit fully in one adult hand if held, never oversized
Discover framing rule: no full faces ever, people minimal or none
If mezcal appears, use a small clay copita or tulip copita, not a tumbler

good_output_signals: image makes you zoom in to understand what you’re seeing
agave textures feel tactile and real
composition feels like an artefact was discovered
bad_output_signals: props feel staged or too clean
